intro: Visnea canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Island mahogany, is a small evergreen tree native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
